## Task 1

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
```

```{r}
source(here::here("src", "storm_runoff.R"))
```

```{r}
# generate seq of impervious fractions
impervious_frac = seq(0.6, 0.8, 0.01)

# use the sourced function to get the volume in feet cubed
volume_vec <- predict_runoff(impervious_frac, 182)

# make these values into a data frame
runoff_df = data.frame(impervious_fraction = impervious_frac, runoff_volume = volume_vec)

# plot the values in this data frame
runoff_plot <- ggplot(runoff_df, aes(impervious_frac, runoff_volume)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  labs(x = "Impervious Fraction", y = "Runoff Volume  (ft^3)")

# save this plot
ggsave(here::here("figs", "runoff_plot.png"))
```
